channel_data.title: AI LABS
channel_data.description: Welcome to AI Labs, your go-to source for the latest AI tools and models for coding. We explore how AI can save you time in building full-stack applications, making your development process faster and more efficient. Stay up-to-date with our in-depth reviews of the newest AI models, where we evaluate whether they’re worth your time. Whether you're a beginner or an experienced developer, we help you discover the best AI tools and models tailored to your needs. Subscribe now and join us as we delve into the future of coding with AI!

videos_data.title: How to Use Cursor AI with Its Own Memory System.
videos_data.description:
Do you wanna know how to Use Cursor AI with Its Own Memory System. In this introduction, we’ll explore how the Cursor AI Code Editor—often referred to simply as Cursor—offers a built-in way to keep track of your coding progress.

LINKS: 
Cursor Memory Bank: https://gist.github.com/ipenywis/1bdb541c3a612dbac4a14e1e3f4341ab
CLINE MEMORY BANK: 

Why Memory Bank?

It stops your AI (whether you’re using Cursor or Windsurf AI) from forgetting past work by storing structured files like project briefs, tech stacks, and tasks. No more repeating yourself over and over.

Originally released by Cline (aka Cline AI or Cline MCP), it’s a sweet way to reduce random hallucinations when you’re coding with tools like Cursor AI, Copilot AI, or even the OpenAI stack.

How It Integrates with Cursor

Supports Plan Mode (the AI decides next steps) and Act Mode (it updates tasks and implements changes)—handy if you’re following a Model Context Protocol (MCP), like React MCP, Vscode MCP, or Cline MCP.

Maintains details about dependencies and progress automatically, so you can focus on building instead of babysitting your AI. This especially rocks if you’re using Cursor Pro (some call it Pro Cursor) or want to figure out how to set up Cursor AI for the first time.

Setting It Up

In your Cursor AI Code Editor (or Cursor IDE, if you prefer), you just paste in the Cursor Rules file and let the agent generate everything you need.

Works great in a VSCode Cursor environment or a VSCode IDE. Seriously, it’s like a 10x upgrade—just like 10x Cursor—and it plays well with other AI coding tools like Copilot or any AI coding assistant you dig.

Tutorial & Beginners

If you’re searching for a Cursor AI tutorial or wondering how to use Cursor AI effectively, Memory Bank is a game-changer. Even if you’re totally new (Cursor AI beginners), it’ll streamline your workflow and keep context intact across sessions.

Editing the config is easy—just tweak the rules file if you spot any bugs or want more customization.

Bottom Line

Between the automatic context retention and the structured approach, Memory Bank is a must-try for anyone coding with AI. Give it a shot, and you’ll save yourself from re-explaining everything while enjoying a more efficient setup in Cursor or Windsurf AI.

comments.author: @Neel-p8z
comments.text:
@AILABS-393 I just wanted to say that I’ve watched many of your videos, and they’ve been incredibly helpful—thank you for all the valuable content!

I have a small request: could you create a video on how to create a proper context file using AI to enhance the functionality of Cursor? The idea is to allow users to explain their entire project in their own words, detailing all the key aspects. Then, they could attach a well-structured prompt that generates a context README file.

This context file would help Cursor understand the project thoroughly, making it easier to build features without the need for lengthy prompts or continuous follow-ups for adding or fixing functionalities. Essentially, it would allow Cursor to work seamlessly based on the provided context file, ensuring smooth project development.

It would be great if you could structure the video around this concept to make it easy for users to implement. Looking forward to your thoughts and hoping to see this in one of your upcoming videos!

Thanks again for your amazing work!

comments.author: @andyandmarcuss
comments.text: love the video, so cool!

comments.author: @JeffHiggins-hp5zz
comments.text: I tried this Memory Bank stuff (the same repo) about two weeks ago and it simply did not work on any medium to large code bases especially with any refactoring / corrective instructions. If you're starting from scratch with maybe a small project, perhaps it could add value with decent effort into the set up and keep things / development linear. Otherwise I found at the first refactor / telling the agent it did something wrong or do this differently (these are logged in the memory .md files) it started getting completely messed up. Looking into the "memory files" it like was kind of sequentially updating them and doesn't really make the full memory consistent as it goes. Like when instructed "don't do this" or "that's close but I really want the structure of the code to look like this..." it adds that stuff to the memory but doesn't really refactor/ make consistent the whole memory files set up. With the llm/ agent stuff once you find yourself trying to say "undo that" or manually editing long "memory files" to try and get it always set up in the right it's just a complete productivity no go. Kind of shameful when these videos don't actually test the tool on literally what the tool claims to help with. Like "it's a complete game changer" in theory... but doesn't work at all in any practical use case...

videos_data.title: Replit Has Become Essential to My Vibe Coding Workflow.
videos_data.description:
In this video, I introduce a streamlined, AI-powered workflow becuase replit has become essential to my vibe coding workflow.. This is the essence of vibe coding — fast, clean, and collaborative using tools like Cursor AI, Claude 3.5 Sonnet, and Windsurf AI.

Links from the video:

SuperWhisper (Claude Voice Input):
https://superwhisper.com/

Replit (Support the channel by signing up through this link):
https://replit.com/refer/MalikAdil

Windsurf (Codeium’s Backend Integration Tool):
https://codeium.com/windsurf


PROMPT: 
I need to develop a frontend application with the following specifications:
Pages Required:
[LIST KEY PAGES AND THEIR PRIMARY FUNCTIONALITY]
User Roles and Permissions:
[DEFINE WHO CAN DO WHAT IN THE SYSTEM]
Shared Components:
Navigation System - [DESCRIBE NAVIGATION APPROACH: Sidebar, Top nav, etc.]
Header/Top Bar - [DESCRIBE COMMON ELEMENTS: user info, theme toggle, etc.]
Breadcrumbs - (If needed for hierarchical navigation)
Modals/Popups:
[LIST MAIN INTERACTIVE ELEMENTS THAT APPEAR AS OVERLAYS]
Technical Requirements:
Use [SPECIFY CSS FRAMEWORK] for styling
Focus on component reusability
Implement URL-based routing for all pages
Create proper hooks and services for API data handling
Develop a mock API store with realistic data structure (including IDs)
Ensure the application is fully functional end-to-end
Additional Considerations:
[ANY SPECIFIC TECHNICAL OR UX REQUIREMENTS]
Please develop this application with clean, maintainable code and intuitive user experience.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

You'll learn how to use Claude AI in voice mode (yep, the new Claude 3.7) to brainstorm ideas and generate structured prompts. This workflow embodies the vibe coding cursor style — no drag, just flow. We also tap into Cursor AI tutorial methods to plan, scaffold, and build apps with clean architecture.

Frontend magic happens on Replit using the upgraded ShadCN UI, while Windsurf handles backend integration with tools like FastAPI and in-app debugging via UI previews and console logging. This is cursor vibe coding in action.

Throughout the build, you’ll see AI agents like Cursor Agent, Lovable AI, Aider, and Cline come into play, showcasing how ai agents explained is more than a buzzword — it’s a developer’s secret weapon.

We also take a peek at tools like Bolt.new, Bolt AI, 03mini, r1, v0, and v3, plus LLMs like OpenAI, ChatGPT, Llama, and DeepSeek. Whether you’re wondering what is vibe coding or want to know how cursor ai vibe coding compares to Github Copilot, this video’s got you.

Oh, and if you’ve been asking cursor ai vibe coding claude sonnet como funciona, I break that down too.

The build is API-first, leveraging OpenAI responses API, and designed to move fast from ideation to deployment — perfect for MVPs or hackathons.

This is lovable dev energy in motion. If you're into AI, Cursor, Gemini 2.5, or building with ai agents tutorial, you're going to love this.

Subscribe for more Cursor AI, vibe coding cursor ai, and next-gen dev tool content.

videos_data.title: Vibe Coding Made Easy: The Essential Cursor AI Tool!
videos_data.description:
In this video, I show you how I built a complete wallpapers app using Cursor and a powerful tool called Task-Master AI — designed specifically to fix one of the biggest headaches when working with Claude: context window issues.

If you’ve ever tried vibe coding cursor or cursor vibe coding and found Claude 3.5 Sonnet or Claude 3.7 getting lost halfway through, asking for a new chat every few steps — this tool is your new best friend. It brings that real vibe coding experience to life with cursor ai vibe coding. You’ll finally understand what is vibe coding, and how tools like Task-Master AI and Cursor AI elevate it.

In this build, Cursor agent works like a dev partner. No context loss, no chaos. Just clean, efficient workflows — kind of like how ai agents are meant to work. If you're into ai, this one hits hard.

Here's what I cover in the video:

Installing Task-Master globally or per project

Setting up API keys (including Anthropic and optional Perplexity)

Using the tool to brainstorm with the Cursor AI tutorial

Turning a PRD into actionable steps

Letting the ai agent handle execution

Avoiding context overload via smart task breakdowns

This is perfect for fans of openai, ChatGPT, Llama, DeepSeek, Gemini 2.5, or anyone who’s tried tools like Bolt AI, Bolt.new, 03mini, r1, or v3. The workflow also gels well with Windsurf AI, Github Copilot, Replit Agent, Aider, Cline, and Lovable AI.

The best part? Lovable and responsive. You can shift direction mid-way, and it adjusts. This makes cursor ai feel less like an autocomplete and more like a true ai agents tutorial. I even demo how much it cost using Claude 3.5 Sonnet (spoiler: very affordable).

We also explore how responses api openai plays a part, and how cursor ai, openai, and ai agents explained all tie together in your dev flow.

By the end, you’ll see a fully working wallpapers app built entirely in cursor with ai agents running the show.

And yes — I also explain vibe coding cursor ai claude sonnet como funciona 😄

Check it out, try it for yourself, and let me know your thoughts. Don’t forget to like, subscribe, and drop a comment if you’ve been exploring the v0 of these tools or are deep into cursor ai builds already.

Link to the tool: https://github.com/eyaltoledano/claude-task-master

videos_data.title: Develop Faster using the browser tools MCP Cursor/Windsurf.
videos_data.description:
You can develop faster using the browser tools MCP Cursor/Windsurf. In this video, I'll show you an incredibly powerful tool that not only integrates with Cursor but also plays nicely with modern solutions like cursor ai and even a free cursor alternative. Developed in top ai labs and built as a robust ai coding assistant with a full suite of ai coding tools, BrowserTools MCP leverages artificial intelligence and the model context protocol to take your web development to the next level.

You'll get a full breakdown on the cursor mcp setup, including detailed instructions on installing the Chrome extension and configuring both the mcp server and python mcp server. If you're familiar with windsurf mcp or curious about windsurf ai, you'll appreciate our dedicated windsurf mcp guide and insights on how windsurf ai mcp integrates with popular environments like windsurf ide.

We'll also compare BrowserTools MCP with other industry leaders such as claude mcp and codeium—even diving into codeium windsurf—to show you why many in software engineering consider it the ai code king of modern coding. Plus, if you're exploring alternatives, our video covers everything from a reliable cursor alternative to a comprehensive cursor guide and a smooth cursor editor experience.

For those looking to automate and innovate further, we’ve included an ai agent tutorial and an ai agent builder segment, empowering you to create smart ai agents that handle routine tasks effortlessly. We'll even touch on advanced topics like setting up an mcp subagent and discuss how our solution stands out as a cursor mcp setup champion in the competitive saas landscape—fully compatible with platforms like openai.

Whether you’re just starting out with coding or are a seasoned pro looking to integrate next-generation tools, this demo covers it all—from advanced configurations with the model context protocol to hands-on examples of a complete ai code editor environment. If you’re into innovations from ai labs and need that extra edge with a reliable cursor alternative, this video is your go-to resource.

If you find this video helpful, be sure to subscribe for more content on cutting-edge, AI-powered development tools. Drop a comment if you have questions or if there’s anything specific you’d like to see next!
Useful Links:
📌 Installation Guide: https://browsertools.agentdesk.ai/installation
📌 GitHub Repository: https://github.com/AgentDeskAI/browser-tools-mcp?tab=readme-ov-file

videos_data.title: I Built an MCP Server with a Single Prompt!
videos_data.description:
In this video, we'll be talking about the tool that lets you build MCP with a single prompt. Are you looking for an easy way to create mcp servers without writing any code? In this video, I'll show you how I used MCPify.ai to generate fully functional mcp servers just by providing a prompt. Whether you're into the classic mcp setup, exploring the model context protocol, or diving into advanced features like claude mcp and claude ai, you're in for a treat.

We'll kick things off with a simple Weather API mcp server tutorial. I'll walk you through providing prompts, setting API keys as environment variables, and troubleshooting when things go sideways. You'll even see examples of setting up a python mcp server and a cursor mcp server. Plus, I'll explain how the model context protocol ai agent works with ai agents, giving you a solid mcp tutorial experience.

Next, we'll level up with an advanced example-building a file system mcp server for Figma. With just a few instructions, I set up a system to retrieve file or node data from Figma links. I'll cover how to configure access tokens, handle responses, and even integrate these servers into cursor for smoother project workflows with cursor ai. And for those curious about automation, I'll throw in some playwright automation tips to make your life easier.

I'm also diving into niche integrations like claude mcp and anthropic mcp. We'll explore both anthropic model context protocol and claude model context protocol, and even look at how to build an mcp ai agent. If you're interested in an mcp server anthropic approach or want to experiment with anthropic claude features alongside popular llm integrations, you'll find plenty of insights here.

By the end of the video, you'll have a clear understanding of how MCPify.ai works and how to use it effectively to create your own automation tools-whether you need an API integration, a data retrieval system, or a custom automation workflow using model context protocol. If you're excited about exploring everything from ai agents to advanced setups like claude mcp and anthropic tools, this video is just for you.

If you found this video helpful, don't forget to like, subscribe, and hit the notification bell for more AI-powered tutorials. Thanks for watching, and see you in the next one!

videos_data.title: This Cursor MCP setup is the most effective way to clone any app.
videos_data.description:
This Cursor MCP setup is the most effective way to clone any app. In this video, I demonstrate how to use Firecrawl MCP to extract metadata from a website and generate an accurate design based on that data. Unlike simply asking an AI agent to replicate a site, I provided the actual website link, allowing the MCP server to scrape the data and create a one-to-one design, including the original images.

Links: 
Github repo: https://github.com/mendableai/firecrawl
Website: https://www.firecrawl.dev/


I'll guide you through setting up the MCP server while integrating advanced tools like Cursor AI and Windsurf MCP. By leveraging modern artificial intelligence—including cutting-edge AI coding assistants, innovative AI coding tools, and a sleek AI code editor (plus even a Python MCP server option)—this setup employs the model context protocol and hints at robust configurations like Claude MCP for real software engineering challenges. Whether you follow a traditional Cursor guide or explore a free cursor alternative, you’ll find plenty of value here.
We also dive into configuring Windsurf IDE and setting up Windsurf AI MCP, offering a complete Windsurf MCP guide along the way. I cover everything from AI agents and agent builders to a quick ai agent tutorial, making it ideal for anyone into coding, whether you’re a coding enthusiast or an AI code king. Plus, I throw in insights on popular tools like Codeium and Codeium Windsurf to round out this saas-ready approach—making it a top cursor alternative and even a viable mcp subagent and cursor editor solution.
By the end of the video, you'll see a complete demo where I use Firecrawl MCP to recreate Notion's landing page, generating key components like the Hero section and Product Card. Although there are some styling issues due to metadata limitations, the tool's accuracy—backed by OpenAI and the expertise of windsurf ai and mcp server setups—is impressive.
If you're looking for an efficient way to extract and generate websites with a blend of traditional coding and modern AI innovations like model context protocol, cursor alternative strategies, and even windsurf ai mcp techniques, this tool is a game-changer.

videos_data.title: Simply Select a Frontend Element, and request changes.
videos_data.description:
In this video, we dive into the powerful features of WindSurf, the next-gen code editor that's revolutionizing frontend development. Watch as we explore the new Select-to-Edit feature, where simply pointing to an element automatically implements changes like text color adjustments and animations! This tool is designed to make frontend development faster and more efficient, without needing to manually specify every change.

We also highlight the Cascade tool, which now automatically handles edits, detects errors, and makes suggestions to improve your workflow. Plus, see how WindSurf is taking it further with new features like Tab to Import, DeepSeek v3 with no credits required, and integration with powerful AI models like Claude 3.7 and GPT-4.5.

Other exciting updates include:

Linter Integration in Cascade for smoother error handling
Suggested Actions that intelligently improve your workflow
Drag-and-drop file support for easier file management
Built-in documentation for MCPs
Admin control for models to fine-tune your development environment
This video shows you how WindSurf is transforming the way developers approach frontend work with its seamless AI-powered features. If you’re looking to boost your development speed and enhance your workflow, this is the tool you need!

videos_data.title: Build FRONTEND Faster Than Ever with This Cursor MCP Setup!
videos_data.description:
Speed Up Frontend Development with the MCP Server in Cursor, WindSurf, and VS Code

Resources & Links:

Get MCP Server: https://github.com/21st-dev/magic-mcp
Sign up for MagicMCP: https://21st.dev/magic
Explore 21st.dev UI Elements: https://21st.dev/?tab=components&sort=recommended

In this video, I’ll show you how to streamline your frontend development using the MCP server—a powerful tool that lets you generate and implement full UI components with just a single prompt. Get started with a simple cursor mcp setup that quickly brings your project to life. Whether you're working in Cursor, WindSurf, or VS Code, you'll appreciate how the cursor mcp system integrates seamlessly into your workflow. Learn how cursor ai enhances your coding experience with smart, context-driven suggestions.

We also dive into the model context protocol, an innovative approach where the mcp acts as the engine behind smart development. If you're a longtime cursor user, integrating ai into your toolkit is a game changer. Experience a unique mcp cursor feature that not only automates component insertion but also comes with a model context protocol example that you can try out immediately. The video breaks down the process with the model context protocol explained and offers a handy model context protocol tutorial. Plus, you’ll see how model context protocol servers communicate effortlessly, including insights on model context protocol anthropic practices to ensure ethical AI integration.

This tutorial also covers an ai coding assistant that helps you spot issues in real time, compares various ai coding tools, and showcases an ai code editor for rapid development. For those on the WindSurf platform, check out the windsurf mcp integration and explore how windsurf ai features bring intelligent design suggestions to your project. Follow our windsurf mcp guide for detailed setup instructions, and discover why windsurf remains a top choice for creative developers.

We also touch on modern techniques in ai coding and demonstrate how ai agents can handle repetitive tasks. With the latest in artificial intelligence powering these features, your software engineering projects can reach new levels of efficiency. And if you’re searching for a cursor alternative, this video even benchmarks the ai code king against traditional methods. We cover essential coding practices, introduce the innovative claude mcp variant, and explain how this service is offered as a saas solution. For an even more integrated experience, check out the windsurf ide setup.

Watch our live demo of the mcp server in action and see why tools like codeium are quickly becoming popular. A dedicated claude mcp tutorial segment walks you through advanced features, while backend enthusiasts will appreciate the python mcp server configuration. Need more guidance? Our cursor mcp guide is available as a resource to help you navigate through setup challenges. We also highlight how windsurf ai mcp features merge smart design with automation, and include an ai agent tutorial to show you how to build custom workflows using the ai agent builder.

The video wraps up with a discussion on future trends, featuring insights from openai and a comprehensive cursor guide for beginners. We even review a unique integration called codeium windsurf and introduce the concept of an mcp subagent for modular task management. Enjoy a smooth experience with our intuitive cursor editor, and don’t miss the exciting upgrades featured in windsurf wave 3. Finally, check out the new ai cursor alternative and learn about a free cursor atlernative option that keeps your budget in check.

What You’ll Learn:

How the MCP Server Works – A step-by-step breakdown of component generation and integration.
Installation Guide – Simple instructions for setting up on Cursor, WindSurf, and VS Code.
Key Features – Detailed insights into tools like the Magic Component Builder, Logo Search, and Component Inspiration.
Limitations & Pricing – What’s free, what requires an upgrade, and alternative tools you can consider.
Live Demo – Watch the MCP server build a component from a single prompt.

If you're looking to speed up UI development, cut down on manual coding, and integrate AI-powered design tools into your workflow, this video is a must-watch. Don't forget to like, subscribe, and turn on notifications for more content on innovative dev tools and workflows!
